arm_group.description: All patients presenting to the Head and Neck Cancer Clinic at the Princess Alexandra Hospital, Brisbane, Australia are invited to participate.

biospec_descr.textblock:
Participants are asked to give their consent for researchers to obtain tissue from tumour
      blocks. This tissue is taken as part of their normal care and treatment. If consent is
      given, formalin-fixed paraffin embedded (FFPE) tissue samples will be used to determine HPV
      status.

brief_summary.textblock:
This study is designed to refine the aetiological causes of cancers of the head and neck and
      investigate the ways in which human papillomavirus and life-style factors cause head and
      neck cancers.  This study will determine if these factors affect the treatment of cancer.

      All patients attending the Head and Neck Clinic at the Princess Alexandra Hospital is
      invited to complete a risk factor questionnaire and give consent for their clinical data and
      tissue samples to be available for future research activities. The risk factor questionnaire
      is based on existing validated instruments developed by the QIMR Berghofer Medical Research
      Institute Cancer Control Group, and will collect standardised information relating to
      demographics and causal factors (tobacco and alcohol intake), risk modifiers (dentition,
      asprin and non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDS), height, weight, physical
      activity, diet quality etc) and behaviours (oral sex etc)

clinical_study.brief_title: The Princess Alexandra Hospital and the QIMR Berghofer Medical Research Institute Head and Neck Cancer Study
condition: Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma

detailed_description.textblock:
Data is collected using a simple four-page paper-based questionnaire. Information to be
      collected include age, sex, height and weight (at age 20, current age, and heaviest ever),
      history of cancer (own and partner). Questions about recreational physical activity, smoking
      history and alcohol consumption, acid reflux, heartburn, denture use and tonsillectomy,
      frequency of use of paracetamol, antihistamine and NSAIDS.

      The questionnaires also ask participants some detailed questions about sexual behaviour and
      history if they are comfortable to give this information.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  All patients presenting to the Head and Neck Cancer Clinic at the Princess Alexandra
             Hospital Brisbane Australia.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  nil

study_pop.textblock:
All patients presenting to the Head and Neck Cancer Clinic at the Princess Alexandra
        Hospital, Brisbane, Australia.  Patients may be be new patients or old patients and may
        have a new diagnosis or they may have a recurrence.

keyword: Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma
clinical_study.official_title: An Epidemiological Study of Mucosal Squamous Cell Carcinomas of the Head and Neck

other_outcome.measure: To compare subjects who have ever been exposed with those who have never been exposed.
To estimate the effect of each exposure adjusted for the confounding effects of other exposures.
To test for trends in head and neck squamous cell carcinoma

primary_outcome.measure: To identify exposures associated with an increased risk of head and neck squamous cell carcinoma

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.source: Queensland Centre of Excellence for Head and Neck Cancer

lead_sponsor.agency: Queensland Centre of Excellence for Head and Neck Cancer
